field.name: Event name
field.definition: the name of an occurrence or occasion that contributes to or results in the creation or presentation of the resource

dos.practice: This field is required for all conference proceedings articles, posters and presentations/webcasts.
When constructing new event names for numbered conferences write the number of the conference and the full name of the conferece (e.g. 6th European Conference on Radar in Meteorology and Hydrology).
When constructing new event names for conferences with year information, name the conference followed by the year (EGU General Assembly 2010).

For AMS conference preprints/proceedings that may contain what appear to be written articles, poster abstracts or slides of the presentation, choose presentation as the title type; choose presented for the status; choose non-refereed as the classification. Do not complete a publication name but do complete an event name. Do not complete pagination information either. Also be sure the written articles and poster abstracts are the versions without the AMS page numbers in order not to violate AMS policies.
If a proceedings is refereed, choose article as the title type; choose published as the status. Then complete both a publication name and event name for the resource.

If a proceedings is non-AMS and non-refereed, the resource could be a poster, presentation or article (choose the appropriate one). The resource is probably unpublished (check that). If the resource is published, then complete publication name. Always complete event name.

Title case the words of an event name. That is, always capitalize the first word of the name and capitalize all other words except words like the, for, of, and, on, in, a, etc. (e.g. World Weather Research Program Symposium on Nowcasting and Very-short Range Forecasting).
Capitalize proper nouns, chemical abbreviations, instrument and model abbreviations.
Separate the event title and the event subtitle with a colon.

donts.practice: Do not end the event name with any form of punctuation, unless it is part of the name itself.

documentation.example: 10th AMS Conference on Polar Meteorology and Oceanography
